owner_contact.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by_contact.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certifier_contact.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_code: NSW - Mid North Coast - ECOPact - NE202L190
product_description.product_type: NE202L190 S20/20/100 Concrete ECOPact General use concrete

product_classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classification.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

hazardous_substances.according_to: Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
manual_calculated_indicators: Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, partially offsetting emissions from cement manufacturing

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation based on value at collection
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach conforming to EN 15804

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector, Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results of environmental impact indicators should be used with care due to uncertainties or limited experience
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
